intro: Gymnosciadium pimpinelloides, commonly known as the lesser false nettle, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the familyApiaceae, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant has slender, hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a distinctive, slightly hairy surface. Gymnosciadium pimpinelloides is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks.
